docs.lead_paragraph: STRENUOUS exercise, especially running and often to the point of exertion, is a key factor in maintaining good health and prolonging life, according to three doctors in the county who are working together to encourage people to stay fit. But since last July, when the 52- year-old author and runner James F. Fixx dropped dead of a heart attack while jogging, these doctors have been doubly busy dispelling in the minds of patients any phobias about running or exercise. Mr. Fixx was a former magazine editor and author of five books, including the best-selling ''The Complete Book of Running,'' and the idol of many joggers. The doctors - Ira J. Gelb and Jerome Gristina of Larchmont and Norbert W. Sander Jr. of Riverdale - all agree that Mr. Fixx prolonged his life by losing weight, maintaining a good diet and running. But, they added, more important was his genetic makeup - his father died of a heart attack at the age of 43 and he himself was not in good health and should have sought the advice of a physician.

headline.main: DOCTORS WORK TO DISPEL RUNNERS' PHOBIA

docs.snippet: STRENUOUS exercise, especially running and often to the point of exertion, is a key factor in maintaining good health and prolonging life, according to three doctors in the county who are working together to encourage people to stay fit.    But since...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration said today that no nonprescription aphrodisiacs had been shown to be safe and effective and it moved to ban them. The agency said that it was tentatively adopting the recommendations of an advisory panel that concluded that people experiencing sexual problems should not attempt to medicate themselves but should seek treatment from a medical professional. It also concluded that some alleged aphrodisiacs, such as cantharides, which it said was the principal ingredient in the material known as Spanish fly, were not only of dubious effectiveness but also posed serious health risks.

headline.main: U.S. MOVES TO BAN SEXUAL NOSTRUMS
